instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
The computer works fine without the battery.
The thing is: I can't charge, bc when i put the battery back the computer don't turn on and i don't get green light.
Already check two different battery, so i'm sure thats not the problem.

Were i can start troubleshooting for give you guys idea what could be wrong with this board?

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: VOltage on SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA without battery???

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: Could be a bad Q7155....  Measure from source to drain in diode mode could be shorted....

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
[USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER]
Pin 4 and 5 Drop to 1v and back 8v (without battery)

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: Diode mode: Pin 3 S and 5 D = 0.468

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
U7100
16 - 8.40 to 1v (after 3 seconds in loop)

C7126 - The same
Q7155 - Pin 4 the same

If the the voltage drop from the U7100 pin 16 (CHARGE_BGATE) all the line will drop too. I think the problem is U7100
I'm right, [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] ?

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: You are hopeless, you are measuring diode mode and giving me a value in MΩ. I just give up.

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: Diode mode: Pin 3 S and 5 D = 0.468

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Can u explain to me, why the voltage drop for 1v and then back to the normal state?
Thats is because the battery is not plugged?

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: The only time anything remotely like this occurred to me was when a PPBUS_G3H high side mosfet was shorted and making PPBUS_G3H 16v. Seeing as your PPBUS_G3H is 8.4v, that is not the case here, so I have no idea either.

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
[USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] I just get new measurements with battery plugged:

Q7155:
Pin 3-2-1: 8.62v
Pin 4: 1.13V
Pin 5: 8.61v

Right now the voltage dont drop.
Also, i don't get green light.

Do you think could be bad SMC?

threads.title: 820-00165-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: ON 3005 Pin 3 i get 8.46V and then pin 1 0V
